title: An in vivo orthotopic serial passaging model for a metastatic renal cancer study
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Ex vivo bioluminescence imaging
Timing: 1 h
This section describes how to visualize luciferase-expressing cancer cells in resected organs.
Euthanize mice with an approved protocol.
Resect the tumor-bearing kidney from three or more mice.
Incubation of the kidney with D-Luciferin.
Place all the resected tumor-bearing kidneys on a 10 cm plate or an according size of plate.
Add 12.5 mg/mL of D-Luciferin potassium salt - PBS solution directly onto the kidney on the plate by a pipet. The volume of luciferin - PBS solution needed will be almost 200 μL per kidney.
Incubate for 5 min.
Visualize and quantify bioluminescence by in vivo bioluminescence imaging.
Note: This protocol is also applicable to visualizing luciferase-expressing cancer cells in the lungs in cases where lung metastasis is of interest.
Dissociation of tumor-bearing kidney
Timing: 2–3 h
This section describes the preparation of a single cancer cell suspension from the resected kidney (Methods video S2[href=https://www.wicell.org#mmc2]). This protocol is also applicable for metastatic lung tumors in cases where lung metastasis is of interest.
Critical: Process of dissociation is individually performed for each tumor-bearing kidney.
Separate tumor from the kidney.
Mince the collected kidney with scalpel to be smaller than 1 mm cubic.
Note: To avoid contamination, samples are sprayed with 70% Ethanol.
Dissociate with collagenase.
Collect the minced kidney in 400 unit/mL of type-I collagenase dissolved in native cell culture media (without any additives like FBS) used for the cell lines of interest.
Incubate at 37°C for 30 min.
Filter cell suspension through cell strainer.
Pass tumor chunk through 40-μm nylon cell strainer placed on 50 mL tube and transfer cell suspension in a 15 mL tube.
Centrifuge at 400 × g at 10 min.
Remove the supernatant.
Wash with PBS.
Add 5 mL of PBS.

Centrifuge at 400 × g at 10 min.
Remove the PBS.
Red blood cell lysis.
Add 1 mL of ACK lysing buffer.
Incubate at room temperature (18°C–25°C) for 5 min.
Add 9 mL of PBS.
Centrifuge at 400 × g at 10 min.
Remove the supernatant.
Critical: If this is the last step of repeated in vivo passaging, cells can be suspended in the culture media and returned to normal cell culture conditions. Cancer cells can be purified using a cell sorter based on the fluorescent protein.
Myeloid cell characterization by flow cytometry analysis.
Dead cell staining with Zombie Aqua Fixable Viability Kit.
Add 1 mL of 1:500 Zombie Aqua Fixable Viability Kit diluted in PBS.
Incubate at room temperature (18°C–25°C) for 10 min.
Add 9 mL of 2% FBS-PBS.
Centrifuge at 400 × g at 10 min.
Remove the supernatant.
Fixation with 4% PFA-PBS.
Add 1 mL of 4% PFA-PBS.
Incubate at room temperature (18°C–25°C) for 10 min.
Add 9 mL of 2% FBS-PBS.
Centrifuge at 400 × g at 10 min.
Remove the supernatant.
Pause point: After fixation, samples can be stored in 2% FBS-PBS at 4°C.
Blocking with FcR Blocking Reagent.
Add 100 μL of 1:10 FcR Blocking Reagent diluted in 2% FBS-PBS.
Transfer samples into a U-bottom 96 well plate.
Note: When preparing samples stained with control isoform antibody, each sample is split into 2 wells with 50 μL each.
Alternatives: A V-bottom plate will be a good alternative if cell pellet will not be packed well at the time of centrifuging a U-bottom plate.
Incubate at room temperature (18°C–25°C) for 10 min.
Centrifuge at 110 × g at 10 min.
Discard the supernatant.
Antibody staining.
Add 100 μL of antibody cocktail.
Incubate at room temperature (18°C–25°C) for 30 min.
Add 100 μL of 2% FBS-PBS.

Centrifuge at 110 × g at 10 min.
Discard supernatant.
Wash with 2% FBS-PBS.
Add 200 μL of 2% FBS-PBS.
Centrifuge at 110 × g at 10 min.
Discard the supernatant.
Analyze with a flow cytometer.

In vivo passage
Timing: 1–2 h
This section describes the preparation and re-injection of the cancer cells into the next mouse.
Wash with HBSS.
Merge dissociated cells from each mouse into 10 mL of HBSS.
Centrifuge at 400 × g at 10 min.
Remove the supernatant.
Cell preparation for inoculation (troubleshooting 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec5.7]).
Suspend cells into HBSS.
Count cell number and adjust the concentration of cancer cells to be 2.0 × 106 cells/mL.
Note: Both the cancer and stromal cells are included in samples of different cell sizes. In general, cancer cells are larger than stromal cells, with a diameter between 5 and 20 μm. It is good to separately count the cancer cells from the stromal cells based on their size. Repeated renal subcapsular inoculation can be performed with the mixed population of the cancer cells and the stromal cells.
Critical: To avoid exceeding clonal selection, prepare three or more tumor-bearing mice.
Renal subcapsular inoculation. Please follow the protocol shown above. Inoculate 1.0 × 105 cells of cancer cells suspended in 50 μL.
While considering humanitarian endpoints, the mice were kept. Once the survival time of derivative-bearing mice reaches almost half that of those bearing parental cells, cells can be established as highly malignant derivatives.
Evaluate activity of Luc2 in highly malignant derivatives. Please follow the protocol shown in step 1 before you begin[href=https://www.wicell.org#before-you-begin] (troubleshooting 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec5.9]).
